intro: Anagallis flava, commonly known as the yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Anagallis flava is often found in clusters, with its stems branching out to form a low-growing, spreading habit.
